column5: I've noticed most of you consider your selves beer drinkers... but I've also noticed the word "COLD" associatedwith the word beer???... down south here, it's considered one word "Coldbeer"!!!... used again mainly by pregnant women and small children!!!... man did not invent the distilling process to be ignored!!!  I've seen from a few "TRUE" beer drinkers, they prefer their beer at an ambient temperature... also known as Weasel Piss flavor/temp!

Excellent beer! I had a couple earlier this summer. But North Bay LCBO doesn't stock it, and the big Sudbury store stopped stocking it.    They're welcome to it!  If God had meant for man to drink beer warm, we wouldn't have ice coolers and refrigerators.
I tried Hoegaarden on tap few years ago and very impressed with it.  Almost has a floral taste but whatever, it was good.

That's my fault, anytime I find a beer I like it soon disappears from the shelves from our overpriced, unionized gov't monopoly stores.  Aaargh. Now that the provincial gov't has pretty much devastated the corner store with their war on tobacco, they could atleast open up the option for some depanneurs, like other more civilized provinces.
So you're the guy that buggered it all up. Thanks a lot!
Yuengling isn't a micro-brewery.  It is also the oldest brewery in North America.  Great beer!  Grolsh Guinness Sam Adams Boston Lager Sapphire Titos Vodka Jack Daniels  Too many to list.
...and what's the origin of your first two choices?
1 Grolsch 2 Keith's 3 Dab (just a dab'll do ya) 4 Stella Artois 5 whatever someone is offering
Absolutemundo Jedi. But I will settle for some Toby's or St. Andrew's Ale also.
Personally I live by the adage that "there is no such thing as a bad beer, some are just better than others"! Stella on tap! Muskoka Dark

Used to spend money for those premium brews and the classy imports. Lately though, after years of experimentation, have concluded that Lakeport Ale is every bit as good if not better than those pricey brews. One other I enjoy is Modelo Negra, my Mexico tipple.  JF
Doesn't Matter...  if its cold, its gold!
#1 Guiness  dont shoot me  American Budwieser in a can really freaking cold
Hoegaarden or Rickards White or any other Wheat Beer, especially in the summer. Beats all te Canadian and American crap.  Dirk

Beer: Steam Whistle or Grolsch (morning beer - Bud or MGD) Booze: VODKA - a lemon wedge, rolled in sugar, pretend it's tequila! Or tons of ice, some tonic and a lime wedge or easily relaced vodka with GIN! HH
have gotten away from drinkin' beer lately but whatever's in your cooler will do.  beer has been replaced with tom collins, black russians, manhattans, or <insert booze here> sours.
blue & steam whistle

Beer: I go to my U Brew place and it cost WAY less than the Beer Store. Wine: I also go to my U Brew place, but it has to be red wine. Spirits: 151 Bacardi rum with a hint of Gingerale, 151 lamb's Navy rum with a hint of gingerale, Wisers with a hint of gingerale, Belvenie scotch on the rocks.

While I've never had the opportunity to sample them or if they really exist, I really liked the names and labels, using the " Steelhead Pale Ale " as an avatar and this one was given serious consideration. Would love to see friend's reactions if you opened a case of these after a day on the river.

Ah yes, Big Sky... they like their brand names.  I had some of their Moose Drool while in Montana a couple of years ago, with a meal of Black Angus steak. The steak was out of this world. The Moose Drool was, shall we say, passable.
MGD Sleeman Silver Creek
1. Mill St - Tankhouse Ale 2. Canadian 3. Boddingtons 4. Guiness 5. Steamwhistle 6. Red Rock - Grasshopper  Yeung Ling is great too (had to throw in some USA)  lots of great beers out there.

Ah Tuborg Gold is a pretty good one. But you can't go wrong with anything cold. But don't forget the drink order of any fishing trip. Baileys/Coffee then a Ceaser, beer all day, then a few ryes to finish the night off.
I'll take a Heine anyday! Kenny G.

I knew someone would point that out  I have no excuse for the MGD, its just a good smooth beer. as for the coors light. it is not the same as the american coors light. it has more alcohol in it plus its brewed by molson i believe. ( the canadian coors light that is)
Do we know each other?  1. Caffreys 2. Guinness  And if your gonna drink piss, might as well be cheap piss - Lakeport or Millwackie

may i suggest to you Schneider Weisse? this is all ive been drinking lately, simply awesome stuff!    2 other good beers that ive found are Zubr and Zywiec, both Polish beers  As for domestics, ive got a soft spot for Sleeman Cream Ale
I think I'm starting to like you better now!!!... can we go "Broke Back" Musky fishing some day???.......rod tip down!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I like head, but not that much!

What's up with all of these fancy beers...  I got 3 1st-    Molson Canadian 2nd-   Bud Light Lime 3rd-   Coors Light  But I'm too young to drink...or was I too young to buy beer   I always mix those two up..  Cheers, Mike
Gibsons Finest rare, Forty Creek and Crown Royal SR  If we are talking beers, I'm easy...  A nice cold MGD, Coors Light or Guinness will do perfectly.

I saw this on another forum (NF) that I'm a part of and thought it would be a great topic of conversation....  here's mine  1) Yuengling Lager (Micro brew from PA) 2) Moosehead 3) Alexander Keiths 4) Corona 5) Anything made by the waterloo micro brewery
Root Beer
1)coors 2)bud light lime(can) 3)canadian 4)brava 5)budweiser
Beer - Canadian ( I buy carling because im broke ha ! ) Mixed- Rye n pepsi
"Carling Ice" for over ten years now, prefer it to a lot of the premiums and the price is better. Still over priced but better.
1) Keiths 2) Ex 3)Molson Golden 4) Sapparo
Look here: http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.p...806&hl=beer
there are other forums???????  lakeport blue light bud light  no particular order
MOLSON GOLDEN
Rickards Red MGD Corona Moosehead
Mine are - Molson Export - Steam Whistle (Quickly becoming my favorite) - Coors Light
OV   all I'll drink.
Fuller's London Pride (ale) Mill Street Tankhouse Ale Creemore Keith's Ex
Urbock 23 when it can be found Don Sykes lite..micro brewery in Barrie
I don't really buy beer that often so my favourite is whatever someone buys me.  I love my rye and diet coke
right now due to cost, lakeport pilsner. Guinness Pilsner Urquell
It has to be at least 80 proof and clear or brown... mixed with Pepsi on ice!!!   I've said it before and I'll say it again!!!... beer is for pregnant women and small children!
And Moonshine is for Rednecks....

Carling, PC Genuine Lager, Canadian, Red Baron, Upper Canada Lager, Brava, Blue, Bohemian, all completely interchangeable - eenee, meenee, mynee, mo.  Rye (anything but CC) and Pepsi.  All preferably good and cold.  I'm not too fussy, especially if it's somebody else's treat.
Wychwood  Black Wych stout.  What's the matter lager boys, afraid you might taste something?
Damn straight Bubba!!!

For us poor folk, Lakeport is gonna have to do.  Real faves are all drafts.  Keiths  IPA 10 Penny ( no longer brewed, pity) Olands Red Double Diamond  Most disliked beers are those brewed by Molsons American
Bass Ale...what else?

In the time and place I grew up, lager was considered a woman's drink, real men drank ale.  I drank Ex for years but I developed diabetes and it does funny stuff to my glucose levels now so I pretty much stick to straight up scotch.
Thats american beer.   1.Miller genuine draft 2.coors light 3. labbat blue 4.keiths 5.whatever i can afford
